ref: 11671 *vigrōcati ʻ robs ʼ. 2. *vigrōcana -- n. ʻ robbing ʼ. 3. *vigrucyatē ʻ is robbed ʼ. 4. *vigrukta -- ʻ robbed ʼ. [Cf. grṓcati, glṓcati ʻ robs ʼ Dhātup., aor. agrucat, agrōcīt Pāṇ. -- √gruc]
P. bagoṇā ʻ to injure, calumniate ʼ; O
Aw. bigoye m. pl. ʻ hurt, oppressed ʼ;
H. bigonā ʻ to mislead, destroy ʼ; O
G. vigovũ, vagovvũ ʻ to revile ʼ. -- These words, which equally well phonet. and better semant. could be < *viglapayati (cf. viglāpayati ʻ wearies, afflicts ʼBh
P., glapayati MBh.) can scarcely be separated from the words in 3 and 4 below.
